qas.question: In what year did The Times resume printing news on the front page instead of small advertisements?
In 1967, what well-known family sold The Times to a Canadian publishing magnate?
In 1967, which Canadian publishing magnate bought The Times?
What is the name of the corporation that bought The Times in 1967?
Which other newspaper was brought under the same ownership as The Times in 1967 to form Times Newspapers Limited?

context: On 3 May <a0_0>1966<a0_0/> it resumed printing news on the front page - previously the front page featured small advertisements, usually of interest to the moneyed classes in British society. In 1967, members of the <a1_0>Astor family<a1_0/> sold the paper to Canadian publishing magnate <a2_0>Roy Thomson<a2_0/>. His <a3_0>Thomson Corporation<a3_0/> brought it under the same ownership as <a4_0>The Sunday Times<a4_0/> to form Times Newspapers Limited.
